comments.commentBody:
The doc wasn't biased at all? Then when mentioning the cat incident why didn't they mention that he had first poured gas on the cat and thrown it in the fire instead of letting it slide that he was tossing the cat and it just happened to catch fire? The interrogation of Dassey was an atrocity? You realize that they showed like 3 minutes out of a 4 hour interview right? You do also realize that he went into a ton of detail about what happened including detail that matched the physical evidence? So asking him questions and saying they didn't feel he was being honest is an atrocity? How exactly would you expect an interrogation to go then?

Then 'unbiased' doc also cut out part of the phone conversation that Dassey had with his mom where he tells her that he was afraid of Avery and that Avery had sexual abused him and another family member before. They showed part of this conversation on the doc, so what other reason would they have to not include that portion of the conversation other than to not make Avery look worse?

Or how about the blood vial with the hole in it? The doc left out the part of the trial where it's explained that these vials are supposed to have holes in them because they poke the needle into the hole to get the blood into them. What reason would there be to leave that part out other than to leave the thought in the head of the viewer that the vial had been tampered with? There's plenty more besides that even.

Actually his initial confession lined up with a lot of the physical evidence.  They didn't use his confession at the trial because in order to use it the defense would have the right to cross examine him, and since he refused to make a deal to testify against Avery and was not saying that he lied during the confession the prosecution couldn't exactly call him to testify.  That's not to mention that Dassey had his own trial coming up after this one.  Amazing that yet another person who watched the documentary doesn't have their facts straight... And you're complaining that someone is getting all of their information for Nancy Grace and didn't watch the documentary?  That's pretty ironic considering most of the Avery supporters know nothing about this case other than what they saw on the documentary.  Maybe the original poster has just actually taken the time to read more into the case?  Maybe he's seen/heard the actual confession from Dassey instead of just the few minutes shown on the documentary that were designed to make you think he didn't actually say anything?
Can you imagine four years of Trump and his awful tweets?

honestly ... they're all as bad as each other.

nothing to see here, move along

It didn't "cast a shadow" at all. I'm a liberal and this was the first time I was able to stomach an entire GOP debate and actually found it informative. If anything, it put a bright light on REAL candidates for president of the United States, no matter if you support them ideologically or not. It showed how irrelevant Trump really is in a debate about issues.
Trump has probably hit critical mass. He either has the support to win or he doesn't irrespective of what the media, or anyone else for that matter, does or doesn't do.
Roger Ailes called it right: Trump's debate boycott will be his undoing. The GOP should thank Roger -- and now, not later.

Sanders and HRC are not the strongest and most qualified to ever run for this office but at least a vote for either one can easily been seen as voting for the lesser of two evils. How these guys on stage tonight ever got to be part of this process is way beyond me. Most of them are not even interesting enough to grab attention let alone solve the many problems that lie ahead.

They were armed law enforcement officers who didn't want to die at this idiot's hands. Since there were so many of them, maybe it would have been okay to let two of them die? He wanted to be killed by them. He got his wish and did his best to leave them no choice.
Many (or nearly all) commenters here, when describing these people, call them Terrorists.  Most people making protests are not armed.

Reading comments from today's Eugene Oregon Register Guard newspaper, the town of Burn is pretty much split regarding these thugs. http://registerguard.com/rg/news/local/33997701-75/three-more-arrested-a...
"Many local residents just wished they would go away."  Yup.

"cram-in" is perfect, thanks ...

Saddens me for my Christian friends, who know Jesus would have a few choice things to say about these guys.

Whited sepulchers? Moneychangers in the temple? Camels and Needles? Turn the other cheek? Coals of fire: leave the judgment to god?

Atheists are better practicing christians than any of these guys.
Chris Christie's pretend abortion tantrum and Marco's weird Jesus Christ cram-in were the highlights of the evening.
You are going to have a heart attack when Donald Trump is our next President of the United States.
Morris Bentley - Sorry but it won't happen.  There are a lot of ignorant bigots in the U.S. but not enough of them to put Trump in office.
So refreshing not to have Trump there. I'm a lifelong Democrat, but seeing these guys without the Trump factor was indeed refreshing and...in some ways...enlightening.

Rubio will finish better than pundits and jabbermouths anticipated.
They'll go bonkers talking about how "shocking" his ascent was.
He'll do even better in NH.
And it'll make for a nice, neat narrative as we head into the general election.
Yawn
Yawn
Yawn
He is a terrible governor. No in the state can stand him, Republican or Democrat.
GOP   DOA

Without pretending to have any specific knowledge, I submit that law enforcement was cautious and patient in an effort to minimize casualties both among the occupiers, (protesters?terrorists?) and their own officers.  They could afford to wait for so long due to the isolated location of the the refuge and, because of that, the limited threat these folks posed to local residents.  I would like to see this level of restraint and prudence used more frequently in confrontations with the law.

Quote:
"* Most employers that offer coverage today would pay less under a 6.2 percent payroll
tax. Over two-thirds of workers are employed in firms whose employer pays over 10%
of payroll for health benefits.

* On the other hand, small employers that currently do not offer insurance (390,000
between 10 and 25 and 3.1 million under 10) would see substantial initial increases in
taxes to finance the plan through the 6.2 percent payroll tax. This tax would be passed
along to workers in the form of lower wages and other benefits"

http://www.scribd.com/doc/296831690/Kenneth-Thorpe-s-analysis-of-Bernie-...

I am a CNM, PhD. Thanks for citing the research and saving me the trouble- Canadian studies also have compared mothers with equal risk profiles who choose hospital or home- and there are more interventions in the hospital. See this: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/26696622

The physician writing this article makes many valid points.
Then you'd agree that we need to end the practice of gerrymandering? I mean, that is if fair representation matters.
Sorry.  My reply was delayed.  I didn't mean to beat a dead emu.

I liked the debate without Trump's presence, and thought that Rand Paul came across well. Cruz and Rubio seemed afraid to admit any weakness. Christie's remark about needing a new dictionary to understand the doubletalking was refreshing and right on target. The Fox people handled themselves very well. Bravo.
The GOP moved their only Republican adult, Carly Fiorina, back to the kiddie table.

A gang of guys "fills the void" left by Trump's disappearance. The bullying gang fills the vacuum with adolescent slurs against Hillary Clinton, playing to the crowd. My kingdom for one Republican adult!

Trump was mentioned two or three times at best. No more than about 15 seconds in total, in a 2 hour debate that felt like 4. "Repeatedly," is misleading, as he hardly dominated the conversation, and for long stretches I forgot he even existed. The other candidates looked better than they ever have before (except Cruz, who came off as petulant, and Rubio, who was salivating for the evangelical vote).

One need not agree with their principles to consider a few almost statesmanlike, and all of them at least mostly sane. A surprising diversity of ideas for those who paid attention, and tougher questions from Fox News than I've seen the NYT lob of late, it has to be said.
Rodger Ailes made a career mistake and Murdoch wont forget it
Well said. I feel exactly the same about Rubio: war and Jesus for personal ambition, it's ridiculous.

You are in denial.
Republican majority in the House
Republican majority in the Senate
Republican majority of Governors
Republican majority in State Legislatures.
All of this has happened in the last 6 years.
America has spoken and the NYTimes Editorial Board and the readers of this paper are out of touch with America and there will be a rude awakening after the next election. So, enjoy your little liberal bubble for another 10 months.

"...[Rubio's] faith would play a central role were he to be president and in another instance referring to “Jesus Christ, who came down to earth and died for our sins.”

What a clown. Just what we need, another George W. Bush, handing the reins of our nation over to Jesus Christ while using war as a tactic for furthering his personal political goals. These Republicans are always claiming their fealty to our Constitution, are they not familiar with the 1st Amendment?

Democratic politics are bad, but Republican politics make me feel like I'm in a giant insane asylum.

I'm sure that the anti-western and anti-American folks are smiling.  Iran gets their victory lap and of course capitalist are ready to jump in bed with them because of course capital doesn't care about ethics and has not loyalty to the country.  Iran is a hard-line Islamist state that hates the USA and is responsible for world wide terror attacks, from south america to NYC.  The current leadership uses the USA as the boogeyman to pit itself against, knowing full well the Iranians have national pride and will rally to their flag, unlike many in the USA, over being critical of their  own kind.  But, to me and others who love the USA and Western Culture, this is a sad day...we are weak and that is just what many in the USA want.  God help us!
